subject: Guidelines for processing increased preconstruction costs before appraisal and approval of project.
text: HRdy <7ey TTTHNf nifearrot 394 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (st 4arT 3k {THTf Hr4) Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 6i-5 & 6, #a<-10, ERoT, 78 fcrft-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/Land Acquisition/2021 Policy Circular No.7.1.73, Dated, 12th April, 2021 (Decision taken on e-File Comp No.6023) Sub: Guidelines for processing increased preconstruction costs before appraisal and approval of project: Refer the Policy Guidelines No. 7.1.67 dated 07.08.2020 containing the procedure for submission Of proposals for consideration & approval of LA Committee in 2 stages viz. 1 (Project Alignment); & Stage-2 (LA Plan). 2 _ In Stage-1, the Design/ DPR Consultant, PD & RO have to submit various alternative alignments of the project highway alongwith LA Costs for approval of alignment: LA Manual of MoRTH of Dec:, 2018 gives the roles & responsibilities of DPR Consultant/ concerned officers of NHAI, which include interalia to give indicative assessment of tentative costs of Land Acquisition based on the collector/ circle rates applicable in such areas and if the indicative cost of LA is found to be prohibitively high, appropriate changes in the project alignment / features should be considered to the cost of LA to an acceptable/ reasonable level Thus, the LA Cost plays a vital role in deciding the project alignment  3 In Stage-2 approval of LA Committee LA Plan alongwith the budget for preconstruction activities are approved and thereafter only 3A/ 3D notifications will be processed. 4_ After Stage-2 approval by LA Committee, the cost of LA may increase in some cases based o 3G awards of CALAs. In such cases, before submitting the project for appraisal and approval, the preconstruction costs be reviewed based on CALA awards and if required, the revised approval of preconstruction costs be taken from LA Committee before submitting the project proposals for appraisal & approval so as to avoid revised sanction of project costs after approval of project. 5 _ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
